definition: perspiration/sweat/CL:滴[di1],頭|头[tou2],身[shen1]/to be speechless (out of helplessness, embarrassment etc) (Internet slang used as an interjection)
see 可汗[ke4 han2], 汗國|汗国[han2 guo2]
water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes

sentences.english: With no wind indoors, for example, sweat will not evaporate as effectively.
sentences.chinese: 比如说室内无风，就不能有效蒸发汗水。

sentences.english: I can't imaging why you are so hot, please wipe out sweat on your face.
sentences.chinese: 我不能想象你为什么那么热，请把脸上的汗水擦去。

sentences.english: He felt a warm trickle of sweat running down the crack to his anus.
sentences.chinese: 他觉得一股热热的汗水沿着股沟向下流。

sentences.english: Great drops of perspiration trickled down from his brow.
sentences.chinese: 大颗大颗的汗水从他的额头上淌下来。

sentences.english: I believe all the sweat and tears, finally become a full bloom.
sentences.chinese: 相信所有的汗水与眼泪，最后会化成一篇山花烂漫。

sentences.english: If you never heard of PKU , don't sweat it.
sentences.chinese: 如果你从未听说过北大，没有汗水它。

sentences.english: Real happiness lies in the fruit of labor produced by one's sweat and toil. (prov.
sentences.chinese: 真正的幸福是用汗水和辛劳创造出的劳动成果。

sentences.english: Toil and sweat done, an apprentice meditates before a Shinto shrine.
sentences.chinese: 一个新手在付出辛劳和汗水后蹲坐在神社前。

sentences.english: I found that depression and worry oozed out of my system with the sweat .
sentences.chinese: 我发现忧郁和烦恼能随着汗水一起渗出我的机体。

sentences.english: More sweats fix gifted face boudoir from the road bottom.
sentences.chinese: 更多的汗水从路修英挺的脸上流下。

sentences.english: Inspiration and perspiration are the ingredients of success.
sentences.chinese: 灵感和汗水是成功的要素。

sentences.english: Also, spandex materials are often used as base layers to soak up sweat.
sentences.chinese: 此外，氨纶材料往往被用作衣服的基础层来吸收汗水。

sentences.english: Success is one percent talent, 99 perspiration.
sentences.chinese: 成功是1%的天才加99%的汗水。

sentences.english: The squad leader, sweat pouring off his face, sat on my legs.
sentences.chinese: 班长坐在我的腿上，脸上汗水不停地流。

sentences.english: The farmers' shirts were wet through with sweat.
sentences.chinese: 农民的衬衫被汗水湿透了。

definition: perspiration/sweat/CL:滴[di1],頭|头[tou2],身[shen1]/to be speechless (out of helplessness, embarrassment etc) (Internet slang used as an interjection)
see 可汗[ke4 han2], 汗國|汗国[han2 guo2]
to sprinkle/to shed (tears, blood etc)/fig. free, unconstrained/to write in a free style
to drip with sweat/sweat poured off (him)
to let drip/to trickle down/to shed (tears)
